result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas R Kuhn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Harassment-Fear of Death/Injunction, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.013(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint.
Comply with Court Order in Waukesha County case 16CV2128.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Sentence credit of 2 days was granted.  TIME SERVED.

Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court.   Defendant Nicholas R Kuhn did not appear.   Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case at the originally scheduled time. Attorney Martinez advises the Defendant is unable to appear at the 9:00 time slot but the Court will recall the case at 11:00.   The Court recalls the case.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court.   Defendant Nicholas R Kuhn did not appear.   Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court reschedules the case for plea and sentencing.  The Court will address the injunction on this date and time.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Pre-trial scheduling order signed by Judge Aprahamian on 6/23/16.

Defendant Nicholas R Kuhn in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court addressess the adjournment request filed by Attorney Martinez.  Attorney Martinez advises the Court that he is waiting for a copy of the transcript from the civil case. The State does not object to the adjournment request and requests the Court set the matter for a motion hearing to address admissibility of evidence and that Attorney Martinez file an appropriate motion to address this.   The Court sets the case for trial and will address any motion regarding evidence the morning of the trial.  Attorney Martinez to file any other acts motion no later than 10 days prior to the jury trial.  The Court grants the adjournment and sets a new trial date. Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Nicholas R Kuhn in court with attorney Michael S. Holzman.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for preliminary hearing, proceeds to hearing.  Officer Ashley Dewart, City of Waukesha, sworn & testified.  Cross examination by Attorney Martinez.  State rests.  No testimony by the Defense.  Testimony closed.  State moves for probable cause & bind over.  Defense requests dismissal.    Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendat over for trial.     NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
